page.title: 08HOUSING MITCHELDEAN AREA
page.content: Throughout the block the older houses are built of stone, often with slate roofs. In the Drybrook area the Forest stone is used, and in Mitcheldean the Old Red Sandstone as well. Here many houses are covered in painted stucco, and there are one or two timber frame ones. There has been some new building in Drybrook, but in Mitcheldean two private estates have been built in recent years. The largest, Carisbrooke Gardens dates from the late 1960's - early 1970's, and the Baynham Road area from the middle 1970's. Most of these modern dwellings are of brick and tile construction. There are some bungalows, but a typical modern home in Mitcheldean would be a small semi-detached or detached house with garage or car port and gardens front and rear.
